page.title: 16TRANSPORT-LT.GADDESDEN AREA
page.content: Buses go in and out of the village six days a week (not on Sundays). Until 1985 the London and Country Company ran the route, but then B. & B. of Potten End took over as a private company. The bus times are few and not very convenient for shopping in the local towns. The cost for a return journey of 12 miles is Â£1.90. The roads are bad and many of them have pot holes, which can cause nasty accidents especially when somebody is riding a bike and a lorry is driving fast behind the cyclist. Cars are used for driving around the area. Most have radios fitted and some Citizens Band. There are a lot of people who have motor bikes and pedal bikes. The area is noted for stables and many people own or hire horses or ponies to ride on the bridle paths through the woods.
